trans-unit.source: Provides contextual information about the trigger that was fired.

The contextual information provided includes the type of action that caused the trigger to fire, which columns were modified in an UPDATE operation, and, in the case of a data definition language (DDL) trigger, an XML EventData structure (see "Transact-SQL Reference" in SQL Server Books Online) that describes the triggering operation.

An instance of <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlTriggerContext> is available from the <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlContext> class, when the code is running inside a trigger through the <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlContext.TriggerContext%2A> property.
Gets the number of columns contained by the data table bound to the trigger.

<xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlTriggerContext.ColumnCount%2A> property is useful to determine the maximum ordinal that <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlTriggerContext.IsUpdatedColumn%2A> allows for a given trigger invocation.
The number of columns contained by the data table bound to the trigger, as an integer.
Gets the event data specific to the action that fired the trigger.
This information is available for data definition language (DDL) triggers.
No information is available through this property for data manipulation language (DML) triggers.
The event data specific to the action that fired the trigger as a <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlXml"></xref> if more information is available; `null` otherwise.
Returns `true` if a column was affected by an INSERT or UPDATE statement.
The zero-based ordinal of the column.
`true` if the column was affected by an INSERT or UPDATE operation.
Called in the context of a trigger where the value of the <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlTriggerContext.TriggerAction"></xref> property is not `Insert` or `Update`.
Indicates what action fired the trigger.
The action that fired the trigger as a <xref href="Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.TriggerAction"></xref>.
